h1_title: Things Black Myth Wukong Doesn't Tell You
content: When used in combos with the standard attack button, you'll perform a Varied Combo, assuming you’ve unlocked the specific Varied Combo from the skill tree in that stance. Varied combos require one point of focus, and unlike standalone heavy attacks, cannot be charged. That said, further upgrades can be purchased in the skill tree that can power them up and allow for follow up attacks that use additional focus points.

This is an excerpt from the file 'Things_Black_Myth_Wukong_Doesn't_Tell_You.md', within the main section titled 'Things Black Myth Wukong Doesn't Tell You', specifically from the subsection '' and the sub-subsection '11\. Heavy Attacks Work Differently'.
The content is as follows:
When used in combos with the standard attack button, you'll perform a Varied Combo, assuming you’ve unlocked the specific Varied Combo from the skill tree in that stance. Varied combos require one point of focus, and unlike standalone heavy attacks, cannot be charged. That said, further upgrades can be purchased in the skill tree that can power them up and allow for follow up attacks that use additional focus points.
